extendedIngredients.name: dried lentils
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup dried lentils, preferably Camellia Brand

extendedIngredients.name: green onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup sliced green onion, tops and bottoms mixed

extendedIngredients.name: lime juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 tablespoons lime juice (one large or two small limes)

extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 cups arugula â€“ 2 cups for each serving

recipes.title: Lentil Cakes with Greek Yogurt Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Cake. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Greek Yogurt Sauce:While the lentils are soaking, prepare the yogurt sauce.Mix all ingredients in a bowl and chill in fridge until ready to use.Preparing the Lentil Cakes:Pre-soak the lentils and rice for 3 hours covered with about 3 inches of water.Once done, drain the water in a fine colander.Add the lentils and rice to a food processor along with the rest of the ingredients and spices for the lentil cakes, EXCEPT for the olive oil and flour.Turn on the food processor and slowly add the olive oil. Stop the food processor and scrape sides as needed.If you have a small food processor, you may need to do this in two or more batches.Once all the ingredients and oil are throughly mixed, transfer to a bowl and fold in the flour gently by hand.Using a one-ounce scoop, shape the mixture into small round cakes. Set on a plate or platter until ready to cook.Cooking the Lentil Cakes:In a large skillet, heat2 T olive oil over medium high heat.Place up to 8 patties in the skillet and cook 2 minutes on the first side.Carefully flip with a turning spatula and cook 1 minute second side.Set to cool slightly on a plate lined with paper towels. Repeat process with remaining batter. You may need to add more oil as you go. Likely on the last batch.Plating the Salad:Place 2 cups of arugula toward the back of a dinner plate.Lay out 6 lentil cakes on the front side of the plate.Using a serving spoon or ladle, place 1/2 c of yogurt sauce in the center  serves as a dip and a salad dressing.

Set on a plate or platter until ready to cook.Cooking the Lentil Cakes:In a large skillet, heat2 T olive oil over medium high heat.
